--- title: "Creating
basic websites" format: revealjs: theme: [simple, ../../css/slide-styles.scss, brand] title-slide-attributes: data-background-image: ../../img/background-hex-shapes.svg data-background-opacity: "0.5" data-background-gradient: "linear-gradient(30deg, {{< brand color yellow >}}, {{< brand color red >}})" style: "text-align: left; right: 10%" # data-background-color: "{{< brand color blue >}}" --- # Anatomy of a
Quarto website {background-color='{{< brand color yellow >}}' background-image='../../img/background-hex-shapes.svg' background-opacity='0.5'} ## ![](img/website-flow-1.svg) ## ![](img/website-flow-2.svg) ## ![](img/website-flow-3.svg) ## ![](img/website-flow-4.svg) ## ![](img/website-flow-5.svg) ## Page Structure :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} ```` {.yaml filename="index.qmd"} --- title: "Global Happiness" execute: echo: false warning: false message: false --- Data from: [World Happiness Report](https://www.worldhappiness.report/). ```{{r}} #| label: setup library(tidyverse) library(quarto) library(brand.yml) whr <- read_csv(here::here("data/whr.csv")) brand <- read_brand_yml("_brand.yml") theme_whr <- theme_brand_ggplot2("_brand.yml") + theme( plot.title = element_text(size = 14, face = "bold"), plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 12) ) ``` ```` ::: ::: {.column width="3%"} ::: ::: {.column width="47%"} Webpages are like any other Quarto document: 1. Start with a YAML header 2. Can include code cells 3. Everything else is markdown content ::: ::::: ## Website Structure A minimal website has two files: `index.qmd` and `_quarto.yml` - `index.qmd`: Renders to `index.html`, your home page. - `_quarto.yml`: Controls project and website properties. When rendered you will get a `_site/` folder. This contains everything needed to serve the site. ## `_quarto.yml` {.scrollable} ```{.yaml filename="_quarto.yml" code-line-numbers="|1-2|4-10|11-15"} project: type: website website: title: "My site" navbar: left: - href: index.qmd text: Home format: html: toc: true ``` ## Quarto projects ::::: {.incremental} Websites are **Quarto projects**. All Quarto projects include a `_quarto.yml` file. :::: {.columns} ::: {.column .fragment .fade-right width="50%"} This is a Quarto Project. ```{.default code-line-numbers="false"} my-folder/ ├── _quarto.yml └── my-document.qmd ``` ::: ::: {.column .fragment .fade-left width="50%"} This is not. ```{.default code-line-numbers="false"} my-folder/ └── my-document.qmd ``` ::: :::: ::::: ## Quarto projects A Quarto project is a *directory* that provides: ::: {.incremental} - A way to render all or some of the files in a directory with a single command (e.g. `quarto render myproject`). - A way to share YAML configuration across multiple documents. ::: ## Quarto projects Not all Quarto projects are websites (though they're typically website-like). ``` {.bash filename="Terminal" code-line-numbers="false"} ❯ quarto create project # ? Type # default # ❯ website # blog # manuscript # book # confluence ``` ## Creating a project skeleton :::::::::::: {.panel-tabset} ## RStudio ::: {style="font-size: 75%;"} File \> New Project \> New Directory \> Quarto Website ::: :::: {.columns} ::: {.column} ![](img/rstudio-new-website-1.png) ::: ::: {.column} ![](img/rstudio-new-website-2.png) ::: :::: ## Positron / VS Code ::: {style="font-size: 75%;"} Open the Command Palette ({{< fa brands apple >}} ⌘⇧P | {{< fa brands windows >}} Ctrl + Shift + P)
and start typing "create project" ::: :::: {.columns} ::: {.column} ![](img/positron-new-website-1.png) ::: ::: {.column} ![](img/positron-new-website-2.png) ::: :::: ## Terminal ``` {.bash filename="Terminal" code-line-numbers="false"} ❯ quarto create project website my-site # ? Title (my-site) › My site # Creating project at /Users/andrew/Desktop/my-site: # - Created _quarto.yml # - Created index.qmd # - Created about.qmd # - Created styles.css # ? Open With › (don't open) ``` :::::::::::: ## Creating a project skeleton ```{.default code-line-numbers="false"} my-site/ ├── _quarto.yml ├── about.qmd ├── index.qmd ├── styles.css └── testing.Rproj ← if made with RStudio ``` ![](img/skeleton-rstudio.png){fig-align="center"} ## Your turn {background-color='{{< brand color cyan >}}' background-image='../../img/background-hex-shapes.svg' background-opacity='0.5'} 1. Create a new website project somewhere on your computer. We'll use this as a playground throughout the course. 2. Open the project in RStudio and explore what the different files look like. ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
03:00
``` ::: ::: # Workflow {background-color='{{< brand color yellow >}}' background-image='../../img/background-hex-shapes.svg' background-opacity='0.5'} ## ![](img/cycle-1.svg) ## ![](img/cycle-2.svg) ## ![](img/cycle-3.svg) ## Preview :::::::::::: panel-tabset ## RStudio ::::: columns ::: column ### Current page ![](img/basics-rstudio-render.png){style="margin-bottom: 0px"} {{< fa brands apple >}}  ⌘⇧K {{< fa brands windows >}} Ctrl + Shift + K ::: ::: column ### Whole site **Build** \> **Render Website** ![](img/basics-rstudio-render-website.png) ::: ::::: ## Positron / VS Code ::::: columns ::: column ### Current page ![](img/basics-vscode-preview.png){style="margin-bottom: 0px"} {{< fa brands apple >}}  ⌘⇧K {{< fa brands windows >}} Ctrl + Shift + K ::: ::: column ### Whole site Use Terminal: ``` {.default filename="Terminal"} quarto preview ``` ::: ::::: [Requires [Quarto Extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=quarto.quarto) for VS Code]{style="font-size: 0.7em"} ## Terminal ::::: columns ::: column ### Current page ``` {.default filename="Terminal"} quarto preview index.qmd ``` ::: ::: column ### Whole site ``` {.default filename="Terminal"} quarto preview ``` ::: ::::: :::::::::::: ## Your turn {background-color='{{< brand color cyan >}}' background-image='../../img/background-hex-shapes.svg' background-opacity='0.5'} 1. ``` ::: ::: # `_quarto.yml` {background-color='{{< brand color yellow >}}' background-image='../../img/background-hex-shapes.svg' background-opacity='0.5'} ## `_quarto.yml` Configure all site-level settings with `_quarto.yml`: ```{.yaml filename="_quarto.yml"} project: type: website website: title: "My site" navbar: left: - href: index.qmd text: Home format: html: toc: true ``` ## Project settings ```{.yaml filename="_quarto.yml" code-line-numbers="3|4-5"} project: type: website output-dir: _output preview: port: 5555 ``` ## Project settings ```{.yaml filename="_quarto.yml" code-line-numbers="4-5"} project: type: website output-dir: _output preview: port: 5555 ``` ![](img/preview-port.png){fig-align="center"} ## Site settings ```{.yaml filename="_quarto.yml" code-line-numbers="6-8"} project: type: website website: title: "My site" description: "Some neat stuff" cookie-consent: true search: false navbar: left: - href: index.qmd text: Home format: html: toc: true ``` ## Navigation settings More on this in a bit! ```{.yaml filename="_quarto.yml" code-line-numbers="6-13"} project: type: website website: title: "My site" navbar: left: - href: index.qmd text: Home sidebar: style: "docked" contents: - about.qmd format: html: toc: true ``` ## Format settings ```{.yaml filename="_quarto.yml" code-line-numbers="11-15"} project: type: website website: title: "My site" navbar: left: - href: index.qmd text: Home format: html: toc: true number-sections: true cap-location: margin ``` ## Don't memorize this stuff! ![](img/website-documentation.png){fig-align="center"} ::: {style="font-size: 75%; text-align: center;"} [Quarto.org \> Reference \> Websites](https://quarto.org/docs/reference/projects/websites.html) ::: ## Your turn {background-color='{{< brand color cyan >}}' background-image='../../img/background-hex-shapes.svg' background-opacity='0.5' .smaller} 1. Edit your `_quarto.yml` to make the following changes: - Change the preview port to 5555 - Enable a cookie consent dialog - Add a site description 2. *Bonus tasks!* - Add a footer that says "© 2025, Myself" - Add an announcement bar that says something **Advice**: - Don't try to make all these changes at once! Remember the workflow: edit, save, preview, repeat. - Use the documentation at [Quarto.org \> Reference \> Websites](https://quarto.org/docs/reference/projects/websites.html) ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

href: index.qmd text: Home ``` ## Answer {background-color='{{< brand color cyan >}}' background-image='../../img/background-hex-shapes.svg' background-opacity='0.5'} ![](img/quarto-yaml-settings-answers.png){fig-align="center"} # Navigation {background-color='{{< brand color yellow >}}' background-image='../../img/background-hex-shapes.svg' background-opacity='0.5'} ## Top navigation ::::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="40%"} ```` {.yaml filename="_quarto.yml" code-line-numbers="6-9"} project: type: website website: title: "My site" navbar: left: - href: index.qmd text: Home format: html: toc: true ```` ::: ::: {.column width="60%"} ![](img/navbar-1.png){width="100%"} ::: ::::: ::: footer Documentation: {target="_blank"} ::: ## Add new page ::::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="40%"} ```` {.yaml filename="_quarto.yml" code-line-numbers="10"} project: type: website website: title: "My site" navbar: left: - href: index.qmd text: Home - about.qmd format: html: toc: true ```` ::: ::: {.column width="60%"} ![](img/navbar-2.png){width="100%"} ::: ::::: ::: footer Documentation: {target="_blank"} ::: ## Entry titles ::::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="40%"} ```` {.yaml filename="_quarto.yml" code-line-numbers="4-6"} website: navbar: left: - href: index.qmd text: Home - about.qmd ```` ::: ::: {.column width="60%"} - Use `href` + `text` to control the link title - Use the `.qmd` filename to use that page's title as the link title ::: ::::: ::: footer Documentation: {target="_blank"} ::: ## Icons ::::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="40%"} ```` {.yaml filename="_quarto.yml" code-line-numbers="7-8"} website: navbar: left: - href: index.qmd text: Home - about.qmd - href: https://www.github.com icon: github ```` ::: ::: {.column width="60%"} ![](img/navbar-icon.png){width="100%"} ::: {style="font-size: 75%; text-align: center;"} [icons.getbootstrap.com](https://icons.getbootstrap.com/) ::: ::: ::::: ::: footer Documentation: {target="_blank"} ::: ## Dropdowns ::::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} ```` {.yaml filename="_quarto.yml" code-line-numbers="9-16"} website: navbar: left: - href: index.qmd text: Home - about.qmd - href: https://www.github.com icon: github - icon: share menu: - href: https://bsky.app/ icon: bluesky text: Bluesky - href: https://www.linkedin.com/ icon: linkedin text: LinkedIn ```` ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ![](img/navbar-menu.png){width="100%"} ::: ::::: ::: footer Documentation: {target="_blank"} ::: ## Don't memorize this stuff! ![](img/navigation-documentation.png){fig-align="center"} ::: {style="font-size: 75%; text-align: center;"} [Quarto.org \> Guide \> Websites \> Website Navigation](https://quarto.org/docs/websites/website-navigation.html) ::: ## Your turn {background-color='{{< brand color cyan >}}' background-image='../../img/background-hex-shapes.svg' background-opacity='0.5' .smaller} 1. Create a new file named `contact.qmd` and paste the content from `about.qmd` into it. Then change it to something else. 2. Add `contact.qmd` to the left section of your top navigation bar. 3. Add a right section to the navigation bar with icon-based links to a few other websites. 4. *Bonus task!* Create a dropdown menu in the top navigation bar, either with links to other websites or links to some new `.qmd` pages that you create. **Advice**: - Don't try to make all these changes at once! Remember the workflow: edit, save, preview, repeat. - Use the documentation at [Quarto.org \> Guide \> Websites \> Website Navigation](https://quarto.org/docs/websites/website-navigation.html) ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

href: index.qmd text: Home - about.qmd - contact.qmd ```` ::: ::: {.column width="60%"} ![](img/sidebar-main.png){width="100%"} ::: ::::: ::: footer Documentation: {target="_blank"} ::: ## Side navigation and sections ::::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="40%"} ```` {.yaml filename="_quarto.yml" code-line-numbers="6-9"} website: sidebar: contents: - href: index.qmd text: Home - section: About me contents: - about.qmd - contact.qmd ```` ::: ::: {.column width="60%"} ![](img/sidebar-sections.png){width="100%"} ::: ::::: ::: footer Documentation: {target="_blank"} ::: ## Side navigation and other settings ::::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="40%"} ```` {.yaml filename="_quarto.yml" code-line-numbers="3-5"} website: sidebar: style: "docked" # Default is "floating" background: "#dddddd" logo: img/logo.png contents: - href: index.qmd text: Home - section: About me contents: - about.qmd - contact.qmd ```` ::: ::: {.column width="60%"} ![](img/sidebar-other-settings.png){width="100%"} ::: ::::: ::: footer Documentation: {target="_blank"} ::: ## Automatic sidebar ::::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} ```` {.yaml filename="_quarto.yml" code-line-numbers="6-10"} website: sidebar: contents: - href: index.qmd text: Home - section: Research contents: - research/project1.qmd - research/project2.qmd - research/project3.qmd ```` ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ```` {.yaml filename="_quarto.yml" code-line-numbers="6-7"} website: sidebar: contents: - href: index.qmd text: Home - section: Research contents: research/* ```` ::: ::::: ::: footer Documentation: {target="_blank"} ::: ## Hybrid navigation Have a different sidebar for different sections! ```` {.yaml filename="_quarto.yml" code-line-numbers="7-8,10-15"} website: navbar: left: - href: index.qmd text: Home - about.qmd - text: "Research" href: research/index.qmd sidebar: - title: "Research" contents: - research/index.qmd - research/project1.qmd - research/project2.qmd - research/project3.qmd ```` ::: footer Documentation: {target="_blank"} ::: ## Don't memorize this stuff! ![](img/navigation-documentation.png){fig-align="center"} ::: {style="font-size: 75%; text-align: center;"} [Quarto.org \> Guide \> Websites \> Website Navigation](https://quarto.org/docs/websites/website-navigation.html) ::: ## Your turn {background-color='{{< brand color cyan >}}' background-image='../../img/background-hex-shapes.svg' background-opacity='0.5' .smaller} 1. Create a folder named `research` and create these files in there: `index.qmd`, `project1.qmd`, `project2.qmd`, and `project3.qmd` 2. Add an entry for `research.qmd` in your top navigation bar 3. Make a sidebar that only appears on the research page that contains links to `index.qmd`, `project1.qmd`, `project2.qmd`, and `project3.qmd` **Advice**: - Don't try to make all these changes at once! Remember the workflow: edit, save, preview, repeat. - Use the documentation at [Quarto.org \> Guide \> Websites \> Website Navigation](https://quarto.org/docs/websites/website-navigation.html) ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ## Answer {background-color='{{< brand color cyan >}}' background-image='../../img/background-hex-shapes.svg' background-opacity='0.5'} ```{.yaml filename="_quarto.yml"} # Excerpt! website: navbar: left: - href: index.qmd text: Home - text: "Research" href: research/index.qmd sidebar: - title: "Research" contents: - research/index.qmd - research/project1.qmd - research/project2.qmd - research/project3.qmd ``` ## Answer {background-color='{{< brand color cyan >}}' background-image='../../img/background-hex-shapes.svg' background-opacity='0.5'} ![](img/sidebar-answer.png){fig-align="center"} # Special pages {background-color='{{< brand color yellow >}}' background-image='../../img/background-hex-shapes.svg' background-opacity='0.5'} ## YAML-based page settings Some page types are based on special templates that use information from the YAML metadata. Two main built-in special page types: - Listing pages - About pages ::: {style="font-size: 75%;"} (you can make your own special templates too!) ::: ## Listing pages ::::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="40%"} More about these in the advanced section! ```` {.markdown filename="research.qmd" code-line-numbers="3-5"} --- title: "Research" listing: contents: "*.qmd" type: table --- ```` ::: ::: {.column width="60%"} ![](img/listing-example.png){width="100%"} ::: ::::: ::: footer Documentation: {target="_blank"} ::: ## About pages ::::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="40%"} ```` {.markdown filename="about.qmd" code-line-numbers="3-9"} --- title: "Ada Lovelace" about: template: solana image: img/ada-lovelace.jpg links: - icon: wikipedia text: Wikipedia href: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ada_Lovelace toc: false --- ## Background Augusta Ada King, Countess of Lovelace (née Byron; 10 December 1815 – 27 November 1852), also known as Ada Lovelace, was an English mathematician and writer chiefly known for her work on Charles Babbage's proposed mechanical general-purpose computer, the Analytical Engine. She was the first to recognise that the machine had applications beyond pure calculation. Ada Lovelace is sometimes considered to be the first computer programmer. ```` ::: ::: {.column width="60%"} ![](img/about-lovelace.png){width="100%"} ::: ::::: ::: footer Documentation: {target="_blank"} ::: ## Don't memorize this stuff! ![](img/about-documentation.png){fig-align="center"} ::: {style="font-size: 75%; text-align: center;"} [Quarto.org \> Guide \> Websites \> About Pages](https://quarto.org/docs/websites/website-about.html) ::: ## Your turn {background-color='{{< brand color cyan >}}' background-image='../../img/background-hex-shapes.svg' background-opacity='0.5'} 1. Create a basic About page for either yourself or some fictional person. - Find an image on your computer or from the internet and add it to your project, either in the root of project, or (better!) in a folder just for images, like `img/` - Add links to different websites (with icons!) - Try different `template` options - Try different `image-shape` options ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
